description.narrative: The six YJR members together with their local partners in 2020 (CARE/ Alnibras, Save the Children and Stichting Vluchteling/IRC, Cordaid/Yamaan, Oxfam/ADF & CHR and ZOA/SDF) will continue in 2021. The programme for 2021 has been designed according to identified priority governorates, based on those where humanitarian needs and gaps are known to be high and where members have access and presence to implement, either directly or with local partners, or a combination. In addition, COVID-19 responses and protection actions will be mainstreamed within the joint responses’ actions. The YJR will focus on Health, WASH, Cash and FSL, focusing on rehabilitation of health facilities, reproductive health support , Mental health and Psychosocial support (MHPSS), and strengthening of health systems, rehabilitation of WASH facilities and supply, NFIs, Multi-purpose cash ( cash for work and unconditional cash), as well as building resilience through capacity strengthening and support of vulnerable and special group of persons in Yemen.

title.narrative: Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: Awareness campaigns have been conducted in targeted areas (Harer-Al Ansi, Harer Al Marfda, Lakma Lshoop) since July 2021 and will contine throughout October 2021.

title.narrative: Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

comment.narrative: CARE has formed the Community Committees (CC) at the targeted areas and structured as follows: - Harer-Al Ansi: 3 male -2 female - Harer Al Marfda: 5 male -2 female - Lakma Lshoop: 3 male -2 female - Harer-Al Ansi & Al Marfda: 5 male -2 female Registration of the target HHs (1000) has been finalized. Hygiene Kits have been delivered to the field but some items returned to the vendor as they were not matching the specification. The distribution will start immediately after replacing.

title.narrative: Percentage of live births attended by skilled health personnel

comment.narrative: Following the readvertisment of the gynecologists positions, the recruitment process has been finalized and 3 gynecologists (1 for each HF) have been hired as of 15th of september 2021. The total number of beneficiaries from RH services reached is of 3,749 individual.

Medical equipment were delivered to all 3 health facilities (Al-Hussien, Harir and Khela) and have been operational since. The rehabilitation process took longer than expected particularly on the procurement analysis, delaying the start. However this will be initiated in Al Hussien Hospital operation room and ICU in October and be finalized by the end of November 2021. In Harir, the process is in its final stage of procurment analysis. The work is expected to start by the end of October and be finalized by the end of November 2021. As per prior explanation of the modified approach, 882 clean delivery kits have been delivered to the health facilities to be provided to pregnant women at their third trimester.

title.narrative: Number of people benefitting unconditional and unrestricted cash

comment.narrative: The 381 HHs have received their 3rd, 4th, 5th and 6th rounds of unconditional cash transfer. According to the new informed gap by CCCM cluster, local authorities and Executive Unit for IDPs, CARE conducted a registration and verification process to 61 new IDPs HH in Al-Dhale'e district. The additional 61 HHs has received their 1st and 2nd rounds of unconditional cash transfer. A 3 day capacity building training was conducted for 14 members (11 men - 3 women) of community committee. The capacity building training focused on leadership, conflict resolution, and community mobilization for Community Committee and included awareness of COVID-19 prevention measures. The first and second PDM were conducted.

title.narrative: Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

comment.narrative: The BoQs and drawings to install the two (2) selected water networks were designed and provided. The installation of the two water networks started on early September, 80% of work already completed, the remaining work will be finished by October 2021. 1- Taraf Hareer villages: Installing 1.8 Km of water pipes, 4 water points, and 8 water inspection points. 2- Al-Anasi villages: Installing 2.7 Km of water pipes, 8 water points, and 13 water inspection points. Status: 80% completed

title.narrative: Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities

comment.narrative: The selection of beneficiaries was conducted in July 2021 in Lakmat Lashaop village, Al-Hussain district as per CARE creteria. The construction of latrines started at the beginning of August 2021, 40 out of 50 latrines have been completed, the remaining latrines will be completed over the course of October 2021. Hygiene promotion activities started in August to increase the overall impact of the installed WASH facilities and to provide a comprehensive package to communities hosting high number of displaced families. Status: 75% completed
